sources.title: Pier 23 (1951) Mystery, Film-Noir | Directed by William Berke | Colorized (with subtitles)
sources.description:
Framed for Murder, Seeking Justice!
Private detective finds himself framed for the murders of a wrestler and a crooked referee, then for the murder of a mystery man posing as a new parolee from Alcatraz. He's a cop's pet peeve... and a gal's pet passion!


Original Black & White version: https://youtu.be/X1H8R1xnKog


Original title:  Pier 23 (1951) AKA: Flesh and Leather
Many subtitle languages available for this movie

Director: William Berke
Writers: Herb Margolis, Lou Morheim, Julian Harmon
Stars: Hugh Beaumont, Ann Savage, Edward Brophy
Genres:  Drama, Film-Noir, Mystery, Sport


00:00 Full Movie (with subtitles)
00:56 Mysterious events unfold as a priest is approached to prevent a potential escape from Alcatraz.
05:24 Mysterious encounter leads to a mission involving Joe Harmon and Father Donovan at Pier 23.
10:45 Investigator uncovers deception and murder in a mysterious case involving a fake identity and a nightclub incident.
14:45 Investigating a mysterious case involving Joe Harmon, Bruger, and a hotel room, leading to a dangerous encounter at Nubian Club.
18:29 Mysterious events unfold at Nubian club involving Joe Harmon, Mike Greeley, and Norma. Detective investigates the case.
23:13 Investigator Bruger receives information about Joe Harmon's whereabouts and involvement in a crime from various sources.
28:48 Mysterious events unfold at Pier 23, involving characters like O'Brien, Giffen, and Norma.
32:14 Mysterious interactions at a wrestling event lead to a deadly outcome and a change of plans.
37:37 Investigating a mysterious case involving a missing girl, bribery, and a trained monkey at Pier 23.
42:04 Mystery unfolds as characters investigate the death of Willie Klingle and uncover suspicious motives.
46:00 Investigation into a murder case involving Klingle's death and the possible suspects unfolds at Pier 23.
50:20 Mystery unfolds as characters navigate through deceit, betrayal, and hidden motives in a film noir.
55:20 Analysis of a complex plot involving deceit, betrayal, and murder in a film-noir setting.


@CultCinemaClassics
Members-only videos https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=UUMOycDFnpMeWzaITQSD1dWsOA

metadata.Plot: In the first of two separate stories, Private-Detective Dennis O'Brien becomes involved with a gang that uses a rigged wrestling match as a means for murder. In the second story O'Brien tries to discourage a convict from making an escape-attempt from Alcatraz. Later O'Brien mistakes another man for the convict, and winds up charged with a murder.
metadata.Writer: Herb Margolis, Lou Morheim, Julian Harmon
metadata.Actors: Hugh Beaumont, Ann Savage, Edward Brophy
